description: From Middle English benimen, from Old English beniman, from Proto-West Germanic *bineman, from Proto-Germanic *binemaną (“to take away”). Equivalent to be- (“off, away”) +‎ nim.

verbs.description: benim (third-person singular simple present benims, present participle benimming, simple past benam, past participle benomen or benome or benumb)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To take away; rob; deprive; ravish [10th–16th c.]
examples: […]  He is now benomme of his lymmes.
